title: In Kazakhstan’s street battles, signs of elites fighting each other
text: The reasons for the bloody crisis in Central Asia remain murky, but experts say popular discontent could mask an old-fashioned power struggle within the ruling faction.

title: Putin sends message to the West as his troops turn tide in Kazakhstan
text: Ahead of high-stakes security talks with the U.S., it also sent a reminder of just how determined the Russian president is to defend what he sees as his own neighborhood.

title: Omicron study in South Africa points to end of acute pandemic phase
text: The infection wave moved with "unprecedented speed” and caused much milder illness than earlier strains, a study at a hospital where the first South African outbreak was recorded showed.

title: Rapid nose swab tests for COVID may not detect omicron quickly enough
text: Manufacturers should seek special approval to allow users to safely collect samples from the throat as well, according to an infectious diseases expert.

title: Ahmaud Arbery’s killers get life behind bars in racially charged U.S. case
text: The three white men convicted of murder in the shooting death of Arbery while he jogged through their quiet Georgia neighborhood were sentenced to life in prison.

title: Kazakh president gives shoot-to-kill order to put down uprising
text: What began as demonstrations against fuel prices grew into a protest against the government and the longest-serving ruler of any former Soviet state.

title: A year later, Capitol riot becomes just another wedge in a divided U.S.
text: In the 12 months since the riot, lies and disinformation spread by Donald Trump have so permeated politics that nearly universal outrage has reverted to separate blue and red realities.

title: Brazil’s omicron toll begins to show even amid data blackout
text: Private diagnostics companies have seen positivity rates skyrocket to as much as 40% in January, up from less than 5% just a month ago.

title: China proposes cutting carbon quotas to help meet climate goals
text: The existing quotas have been quite lenient to polluters, creating a surplus of allowances that has weighed on prices.

title: A year after U.S. Capitol siege, Biden blasts Trump's 'web of lies'
text: U.S. President Joe Biden on Thursday accused his predecessor of spreading a “web of lies” to undermine U.S. democracy in a speech on the anniversary of the deadly Capitol attack by Trump supporters.

title: Brazil stops tracking savanna deforestation despite rising destruction
text: The Cerrado, which neighbors the Amazon rainforest and stretches across several Brazilian states, is a major bulwark against climate change due to the carbon it absorbs.

title: Britain warns Russia over Ukraine: We're working on high-impact sanctions
text: Britain warned Moscow on Thursday that it was working with Western partners on high-impact sanctions targeting Russia's financial sector should it invade Ukraine.

title: Rapid COVID-19 tests are reselling for triple the retail price in U.S.
text: A spike in U.S. coronavirus cases has resulted in skyrocketing demand for at-home kits — and an unregulated private market selling them.

title: COVID-19 testing policies under scrutiny worldwide as omicron surge drives up demand
text: This time last year, vaccines offered hope that the pandemic might be over by now. Instead, the new variant is overloading public health systems.

title: Twitter creates monitoring team to prepare for Capitol riot anniversary
text: Major social media platforms were accused of enabling extremists on Jan. 6, 2021 — now they're claiming to watch their platforms more carefully for threats.

title: U.S. and Taiwan pledge to assist Lithuania in countering China’s ‘economic coercion’
text: Lithuania has faced unofficial trade hurdles and a downgrade of diplomatic ties with China after it allowed Taiwan to open an office in its capital.

title: Israel becomes test case for fourth vaccine shot amid record cases
text: Israel’s pandemic experience has been studied around the world because of aggressive steps it took to contain the virus at the outset — and its botched exit from its first lockdown.

title: Russia sends troops to Kazakhstan to put down deadly uprising
text: Russia sent paratroopers into Kazakhstan on Thursday to help put down a countrywide uprising after deadly violence spread across the tightly controlled former Soviet state.

title: Behind Brazil's 'green' charcoal industry, illegal deforestation and workers' misery
text: This year, 66 workers were found in slavery-like conditions at just one site, according to the head of the Brazil's anti-slavery authority.

title: The U.K. is being consumed by Brexit more than COVID-19
text: One year into "going it alone,” Brexit and the pandemic are morphing into a political demon that risks slipping out of Boris Johnson's control.

title: President Emmanuel Macron tells French daily he wants to 'piss off' the unvaccinated
text: The cutting remark prompted howls of condemnation from opposition rivals less than four months before the next presidential election.

title: Biden to speak 'truth' a year after U.S. Capitol riot; Trump cancels Jan. 6 event
text: Four people died on the day of the riot, one Capitol police officer died the day after. Dozens of police were injured, and four officers have since taken their own lives.

title: U.S. judge skeptical of Prince Andrew's bid to dismiss sex abuse accuser's suit
text: A U.S. judge on Tuesday appeared skeptical of a bid by Britain's Prince Andrew to dismiss Virginia Giuffre's lawsuit accusing the Duke of York of sexually abusing her when she was 17.
